channel.title: Posts on Sujan Arora's Project Journal
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Sujan Arora's Project Journal

item.title: Personal Website Development
item.description: About This Project I have always enjoyed journaling, whether it be about projects that I am working on in school or on the side, or things I am experiencing in my life. It serves as an escape from reality and as a way to reflect on my experiences and improve myself. Specifically with coding, I find it beneficial to journal about school and personal projects because I learn the material better and more often than not discover alternate ways that I could have used to solve various problems.

item.title: Discord Bot
item.description: Update August 1, 2021 As of now, the next season of Trench League never happened and this project is yet to be put to use. Regardless, I learned a lot about Python and the Discord API for future projects. About This Project The idea behind this project initially started two years ago when I was a player in the league. The Trench League is a (very) amateur Dota 2 league that allows players in the ‘Trench’ to play the game more competitively.

item.title: Learning the Discord API
item.description: About This Project The purpose of this project was to learn the Discord API/Python for the development of the discord bot for Trench League. This journal entry will describe my experience creating a basic discord bot with no experience with the Discord API. Where to Start? Step 1 is to create the bot application. This is done by going to https://discord.com/developers/applications and creating a New Application. You then create the bot, add it to a guild, and you are off to the races.

item.title: Crowdsourced Music Generator
item.description: About I spent the majority of my 2019 summer at Carleton College at the Summer Computer Science Institute camp. Throughout this one-month-long experience, I took classes in Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, and Computational Music, and created a research project (focused on computational music) with a partner. The idea for our project was to explore a way to allow users to change the type of music that they are listening to in a public place.
